text:
12 oz bottle into a Belgian snifter. 
Pours hazy pale golden with a thin, semi-durable white head. Spotty lacing. 
Medium-light body with medium carbonation. 
Overall: clean and relatively well balanced for style, with faint banana and limited clove.

Im happily finding that Sierra Nevadas Ovila releases capture a lot Belgian tradition. This spicy, citrusy Wit is a continuation of that trend. Cloudy pale yellow color and a white head. Spicy and citrusy nose. Clove, lemon zest, white pepper, yeast, and banana flavors. Light-bodied and lively feel. Dry finish with just a hint of sourness. A brilliant choice to follow a long, hot bike ride.

Bottle-Pours bright yellow hazy hue with a small fizzy white head that didnt last very long just leaving a small fizz around the edge of the liquid surface. Nose of bright lemons, corriander, light grass, slightly spicy in a german hop sense. very nice. Flavors are slightly sweet lemons, lite tartness, grass, corriander, light metallic notes. Pretty solid overall. Very crisp and refreshing on this 90 degree St Louis day. I enjoy this quite a bit. i may actually go back and get another 6er of this. Long tart and slightly grainy finish. Solid
12oz bottle. Pours lightly hazy pale gold. Thick, foamy white head that slowly dissipates. Nose is sourdough, spice and grass. Yeasty flavors with clove, banana. Pleasant, funky finish.

appearance:  cloudy light yellow, full white head slowly shrinking to a creamy collar.  aroma: slightly skunked but in a good way, with toasted coriander, a hint of fennel, and candied orange peel.  taste: peppery yeast, coriander, orange peel, cracker.  finish: lingering slight yeasty funk over pepper, light grass, and lemon zest; palate is light but fulsome.  notes: 	Great wit. Id like a slightly zippier palate like Port Citys Optimal Wit, but this was quite nice.

Bottle from Bine & Vine. Pours hazy light gold with a slight white head. Aroma of banana with some mild spice - likely clove. Med body, maybe. Flavor is banana/clove. Not mild either. This is so frikin Belgian. Zest is detectable, but I had to think about it. Mostly banana and clove for me. Must be really "authentic" yeast here. Not usually a witbier fan, but love this one. Not entirely dry, and the clove subs for bitter. Just delightful.

Pour is a hazy straw with a huge white head. Aroma is a decent clove and coriander. Flavor is wheat malt more coriander and maybe some orange peel if you use your imagination. This was a fine wit beer. Maybe a tad thin but this was still pretty flavorful.

Pours an opaque yellow.... Sparkling white head. Nice aroma of lemon, Belgian spice, hay. Nice zesty feel, dry finish. Nice marriage of citric and light Belgian things, wood, clove, white pepper. Great take on the style.... Refreshing and flavorful.

Aroma, not great but aroma typically is not on this style. 
Appearance, golden effervescent. Very nice with small white head.
Taste, pretty good and refreshing. Citrus pepper.
Palate crisp ,, easy drinker, Actually drank it much faster than i had hoped. 
Overall, A very good offering. . Not a big fan of Sierra Nevada but this was good. Glad I tried it and will buy it again.
Draft at source. NC. Strong coriander in the aroma. Hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Tatse is similar. Creamy. Wheat. Pretty much hits the style to perfection.

Tap at BeerNV
Slightly cloudy light yellow. Aroma is light, almost to a fault. Very light citrus spice and yeast. Those flavors eventually come out on the pallet, but this is the first Ovila that wasnt a standout in-style.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 Draft at Monks. Cloudy pale yellow pour with a thick frothy bright white head. Belgium wit esters. Juicy fruit. Lemon curd. Banana taffy. Creamsickle. Waffles. Coriander. White peppercorns. Silky full body. Big, soft, and fluffy.
Bottle. Hazy to cloudy golden yellow color. Aroma of bread dough, banana, light spice. Taste is spiced banana bread. Nice.

Im thoroughly impressed by a Sierra Nevada beer for a change! Hazy golden sunshine color with a blanketing head of white fluffy foam. Orange peel right up front on the aroma with some yeast underneath. Flavors comprised of light banana, yeast, subtle soft orange citrus, and peppery in the finish. Well inspired and well made.
Bottle from Wine Warehouse. Pours clear gold with a soft white head. Aroma of banana, sewage water. Flavor is yeast, grass, coriander, baking soda. Its fine, I suppose.
On tap at P&P Charleston. Slightly hazy pale yellow with small white head. Aroma is esters, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is esters and light citrus fruit.
